heading: economy's growing 'gangbusters'
subheading: glowing economic data and expectations of a similar fourth quarter spur the nasdaq to a new high.
author: reuters
text: stocks rose wednesday, with the nasdaq market notching up another record, after the latest data showed the economy remains hot. based on early and unofficial data, the dow jones industrial average finished with a gain of 12.54 points, or 0.11 percent, at 11,008.17. the technology-laced nasdaq composite index jumped 77.62 points, or 2.32 percent, to 3,420.49, setting its 15th record close in 19th sessions.the government reported the gross domestic product grew at a revised 5.5 percent pace in the third quarter, topping economists' forecasts for a rise of 5.0 percent."this economy is growing gangbusters and 1999 is going out with a bang," said wayne ayers, chief economist at fleetboston financial in boston. he said that most economists expect a similar growth in the fourth quarter.the third-quarter gain followed a more modest 1.9 percent rise in the second quarter and was the strongest increase since a 5.9 percent surge in the final three months of last year. the revised gdp number also beat the 4.8 percent increase in the first estimate released a month ago.in another government report, initial jobless claims for the week ending 20 novemeber fell to 274,000 from 287,000 in the previous week. economists had expected claims to hold steady."i think that just basically everything is stronger than most had forecast," said hugh johnson, the chief investment officer at first albany in albany, new york.the s&p 500 rose 12.44 points, or 0.89 percent, to 1,417.08. but in the broader market, declining stocks beat out advances 1,619 to 1,391 on moderate volume of 737 million shares on the new york stock exchange.in the bond market, the 30-year us treasury bond slipped 4/32 and the yield rose to 6.21 percent from tuesday's close of 6.19 percent.internet shares gained ground. "folks are concentrating on the fact that the holiday shopping season starts on friday," said charlie crane, chief market strategist at key asset management. "i think the investors are thinking this is going to be an internet christmas."america online (aol) rose 3/16 to 83-15/16, yahoo (yhoo) climbed 9-13/16 to 231 and ebay inc. rose 11-15/16 to 179-1/2. red hat (rhat), the leading linux software distributor, soared 25-3/16 to 168-15/16. coca-cola (coke), a dow component, rose 1-5/16 to 67-15/16 after the soft drink giant said it would not revise its bid for pernod-ricard sa's orangina soda brand after the french government said it would block the sale.american home products (ahp), rose 1-7/8 to 54-1/4 after the company said it received preliminary approval for a $3.75 billion settlement with the people who took its diet drug cocktail fen-phen. the drug has been linked to possible heart-valve damage.magazine seller tv guide (tvgia) was up 2-9/16 at 62, a day after its directors approved a two-for-one stock split. traders headed for the thanksgiving day holiday. financial markets are closed thursday and on friday, stocks will close at 1 p.m. and bonds will close at 2 p.m.copyright
